channel.description:
im a complete noob to python,and i was wondering how u would make it re-state a question if u got it right
[code] x = raw_input("what is 2 + 2?") if x != "4": print"haha dumby your wrong,try again", elif x == "4": print"correct-smarty pants" [/code]
ok so if someone enters the wrong anser it says "haha dumby your wrong,try again. How would i make it repeat the question if they are wrong..?

item.title: Python noob
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

x = raw_input("what is 2 + 2?")
if x != "4":
   print"haha dumby your wrong,try again",
elif x == "4":
    print"correct-smarty pants"

You could do the following if you want the question too be asked until they get it right.

while 1:
    x = raw_input("2 + 2: ")
    if x != "4":
        print "Wrong. Try Again!"
        continue
    else:
        print "Right!"
        break
